Description: White painted pottery shabti of It-ntr P3-di-Imn with black detail: a striated lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a summarily modelled face with traced eyes and crossed hands holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
Condition: fair - paint worn, cracked at ankle level
Acquisition name: Donated by: Government of the British Protectorate of Egypt
